instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00967: What is 820-00967? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.
definitions.PP1V8_SLPS2R: What is PP1V8_SLPS2R? PP1V8_SLPS2R is a 1.8v power rail present when the system is in a SLPS2R state. .
definitions.PP1V8_AWAKE: What is PP1V8_AWAKE? The PP1V8_AWAKE signal in the MacBook schematic is indicative of a power rail that delivers 1.8 volts when the machine is in an "awake" state. This is not a traditional power state defined in the older Intel PCH documentation; it seems to be specific to newer MacBook architectures. The "awake" designation likely refers to a state where the MacBook is on and ready for user interaction, but it is not necessarily at full operational capacity (which would be denoted by an S0 state).
definitions.PP1V1_SLPS2R: What is PP1V1_SLPS2R? The PP1V1_SLPS2R power rail in the MacBook schematic provides a 1.1-volt supply in a specific low-power state indicated by the "_SLPS2R" suffix and is used for powering the T2 chip..
definitions.PP1V2_AWAKE: What is PP1V2_AWAKE? The PP1V2_AWAKE signal in the MacBook schematic is a power rail that provides 1.2 volts and is associated with the machine's awake state and is used for powering the T2 chip..
definitions.PP3V3_G3S: What is PP3V3_G3S? PP3V3_G3S is a 3.3v power rail present when the machine is in a G3S standby state. .

threads.title: IMAC <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00967</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> power issue
threads.message:
Guys have an imac <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00967</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with no power, no image or fan activity, when connected to another macbook via USB it displays device in recovery, I did revive and reset on configurator app but fails with storage or disconnect errors.


Here are some measurements taken

PP12VR11V_MAIN 11.9v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL>= 3.3v
<SIGNAL>PP1V1_SLPS2R</SIGNAL> 1.0v
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_SLPS2R</SIGNAL> 1.7v
<SIGNAL>PP1V2_AWAKE</SIGNAL> 1.1v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_AWAKE</SIGNAL> 3.3v
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_AWAKE</SIGNAL> 1.7v
PPVDDCPUSRAM_AWAKE .7v
PPVDDCPU_AWAKE_SOC .7v

SOC_USB_VBUS 1.6v
PP12V_ACDC_GPU .5v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> 3.5v
PP3V3_G3W 0v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3S</SIGNAL> 0v
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_SLPS2R</SIGNAL> 1.7v
<SIGNAL>PP0V82_SLPDDR</SIGNAL> .7v


Thanks

threads.title: IMAC <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00967</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> power issue
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

Any history available?
Can you post a picture of DFU error?

threads.title: IMAC <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00967</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> power issue
threads.message:
imac was taken in for cleaning and thermal paste replacement, came back in 2 weeks  later no power. we checked all around and we could not find any missing components or damage on it. eventually through all the motherboard in and out from  the case  L6170 and L6160 came off, ill put them back later.... but i don't think this has anything to do with power or the recovery process.  I'll like to add I tried another SSD.

please advise

threads.title: IMAC <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00967</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> power issue
threads.message:
L6160/70 can't impede the machine to boot.

You may have problems with the SSD connectors.
Check for knocked off component, or broken trace.

threads.title: IMAC <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00967</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> power issue
threads.message: so i checked all around the board specially SSDs area I don't see missing components or tracks.  i checked PP3V3_G3W_SSD0 line its 0v all the time except when i run restore, it goes high at 3v. I assume SSD are getting power. please advice

threads.title: IMAC <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00967</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> power issue
threads.message:
What macOS do you have on the host machine?
Where AC2 is running.

Any idea what macOS is on the target (iMAC)?
